Hospital.Controllers

Class DoctorController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hospital.Controllers.LoginController<Doctor>
      • Hospital.Controllers.DoctorController

  • @SystemAPI
public class DoctorController
extends LoginController<Doctor>
    As the LoginController for a Doctor, this class represents the Doctor when he/she is logged in and provides access to functionality related to this Doctor. This controller enables the following usecases : Open patientfile. Set preference. Undo and redo actions.

      • consultPatientFile

        @SystemAPI
public PatientFile consultPatientFile(java.lang.String chosenPatient,
                                       WorldController wc)
                               throws NoPersonWithNameAndRoleException,
                                      NotLoggedInException
        This opens a patientFile in the system and returns an information-object of it.
        Parameters:
        chosenPatient - The name of the patient.
        wc - The WorldController of the world this patient and doctor belong to.
        Returns:
        An information-object about the patient
        Throws:
        NoPersonWithNameAndRoleException - if no patient was found with the given name
        NotLoggedInException - if this controller was logged out

      • closePatientFile

        @SystemAPI
public void closePatientFile()
        Closes the currently opened patientfile

      • dischargePatient

        @SystemAPI
public void dischargePatient()
                      throws CannotDischargeException,
                             NoOpenedPatientFileException
        Discharges the patient whose file the doctor currently has opened.
        Throws:
        CannotDischargeException - if the patient has unfinished test or treatments, or an unapproved diagnosis
        NoOpenedPatientFileException - if the doctor has no patient opened at the time

      • openedPatientHasUntreatedDiagnosis

        @SystemAPI
public boolean openedPatientHasUntreatedDiagnosis()
                                           throws NoOpenedPatientFileException
        This method returns true if the current patient has untreated diagnoses
        Returns:
        true if opened patient has untreated diagnoses, false otherwise
        Throws:
        NoOpenedPatientFileException - if no patientfile is viewed
